column2: Capitol Rioter Foiled By His Own Facebook Post
column5: Grover is now the eighth Coloradan charged with his role in the January 6th riot at the Capitol. He faces four charges:  knowingly entering a restricted building without authority disorderly conduct violent entry to Capitol grounds and parading demonstrating or picketing in a Capitol building. According to the affidavit the FBI went to his door in February but he declined to speak with them Source: Denver Post Another Colorado man was arrested Wednesday on federal charges after authorities say he participated in the Jan. 6 riot at the U.S. Capitol building in Washington D.C. Multiple videos and photos show that Logan Grover of Erie took part in the insurrection according to a criminal complaint filed Monday and unsealed Wednesday in U.S. District Court for the District of Columbia. Grover also posted on Facebook about planning to participate in the gathering according to the complaint and two tipsters relayed that information to the FBI. “If you accept the reality that the election was stolen than (sic) you cannot accept Biden as the new president — & neither can I” Grover wrote in the Facebook post according to a screenshot included in the criminal complaint. “Which is why I flew to DC yesterday. I fought for this nation.” “I have no interest in violence” he wrote. “Sadly I recognize that violence is highly likely. I’m not certain what’s going to happen tomorrow. I am certain I need to be there.” NEW: Logan Grover arrested in connection with Capitol riot. Another defendant done in by Facebook. pic.twitter.com/SOIKYq2M8d — Ryan J.
